page.title: 01Introductory Page:Deeside
page.content: {Deeside lies along the south-west {slope of the Dee valley.} The settlement consists of the historic village of Hawarden,the Aston Park Estate and the town of Shotton. There are rail links to Holyhead,Chester, Wrecsam, and Liverpool. The A494 which carries 3000 vehicles per hour connects the M56 with the A55 N.Wales coast road. On the south-east valley slope lies the Shotton steelworks , the major employer till its' partial closure in 1981. The unemployment level is some 20% but the Deeside Industrial Estate, Sealand now attracts small scale industry to the area. Farming is mainly pastoral with some market gardening on the sandy soils of the valley floor. Facilities for recreation include the Deeside Leisure centre and Wepre wood, a large area of woodland much used by locals.
